Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Second-Generation HydroCoil Embolic System vs. Bare Platinum Coil in Intracranial Aneurysms

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to HES (n=297) or bare platinum coil (BPC, n=303) using stratified randomisation by site.

Participants.evidence: This randomised, controlled trial enrolled 600 subjects with 3-14 mm ruptured or unruptured intracranial aneurysms across 46 centers in the US and Canada.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to HES (n=297) or bare platinum coil (BPC, n=303).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was aneurysm recurrence on the Raymond-Roy scale over 24 months.

Blinding.evidence: Imaging assessors were blinded, but patients and clinicians were not.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised, controlled trial enrolled 600 subjects with 3-14 mm ruptured or unruptured intracranial aneurysms.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Recurrence occurred in 11 (4.4%) HES and 44 (15.4%) BPC subjects.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Recurrence occurred in 11 (4.4%) HES and 44 (15.4%) BPC subjects (OR 3.97, 95% CI [1.99, 7.92], p=0.002).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar: 286 (47.9%) in HES and 311 (52.1%) in BPC.
